body:
Hi! 
No, Cudnn isn't installed in `/usr/local/cuda/lib64`, it is installed in `/opt/cuda/lib64`, which is the path I give to the tensorflow configure script when asking for Cudnn directory. Is it necessary for Cudnn to be installed in `/usr/local/cuda/lib64` i.e., the same directory as Cuda?

I'm going to try the local installation of Cuda and Cudnn.
Thank you for your answer!
